oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ernest Peckinpaugh tying a bait-casting lure
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of Ernest Peckinpaugh, owner of the E. H. Peckinpaugh Company, Chattanooga, Tenn. tying a bait-casting lure. Peckinpaugh is pictured behind a counter with bait-casting lures displayed in wooden boxes. He is wearing a coat, necktie, vest, button down shirt and glasses.
Founded in 1920 to manufacture the first commercially tied fishing lures, by 1940 the E.H. Peckinpaugh catalog listed 60 different bugs and flies with hundreds of color combinations.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: RG 82: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
